name: Rhyming Riddles Quiz | Word Play | 5 Questions

questions.text:
A rotating toy, kids spin with glee.

Or the upper most point - either one I can be.

Don't stumble on this one - go out for the day.

Or perhaps even longer - have a weekend away.
questions.explanation:
Trip.

	A stumble is a trip, as is a short break away from home.

questions.text:
It's past time to rise - oh! Look at the hour.

As a sign of my love - I give you this flower.
questions.explanation:
Rose.

	The past tense of rise is rose, and a rose is the flower of love.

questions.text:
Covering for the modesty of the first man and woman.

Or going away, both have something in common.
questions.explanation:
Leaves & leave.

	Adam and Eve are often depicted wearing leaves over their private parts, and to to go away is to leave.

questions.text:
A sphere of play - lots of fun.

Or a grand dance, I can be either one.
